1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Though Troy and Erin have been only dating for a year, they are already talking about marriage. And now that Erin has finished the bar, Troy is ready to pop the question, right on the stage. Can he help her win the cash, or will they leave with nothing? And will she say yes to his modest proposal?

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Clancy was Adam's boss, but the attraction was immediate. Now they are a couple that everyone can root for. Does Clancy know Adam well enough to help them win the top prize?

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: BJ and Keila are a long married couple, but their love hasn't faded a day. They have three adorable kids, and Keila accepts BJ's quirky ways, which include a turtle obsession and a wardrobe consisting only of camo. Can Keila help BJ win the grand prize for their family?

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Corey and Gregory have been best friends from the first day they met in college. These energetic friends are clearly the life of the party, and they bring that energy to the show. Does Gregory know his friend well enough to help them win cash to pursue their post collegiate dreams?

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Carolyn and Celina might be twins, but they show their sisterly love with a healthy dose of sarcasm and acrimony. They need the money to help their mom repair the family home. Can Celina help her sister win $250,000?

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Pablo and Eva have been dating for a very short time. This young, attractive couple met on a spring break cruise, and it was love at first sight - after Pablo stopped making out with another girl. Can Pablo help navigate Eva to a win, even though they barely know each other?

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Britt and Jensen are married with one kid, with another one soon on the way. They met in college, got pregnant during spring break in Cabo, and got married shortly after. Can Jensen help her beer-loving husband win money for their family's future?

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Trai and Kristen are a charitable married couple with one adorable kid. Trai hopes he can help his wife Kristen win money so they can donate to a cause close to their heart, cystic fibrosis. Does he know her well enough to help them win?

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Derrick and Jhinezka have been married for three wonderful years and have two beautiful kids. While Derrick is calm and collected, Jhinezka is the exact opposite. Can she keep her cool on stage long enough to stash some cash away for their children's future?

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Ashley and Maggie are living proof that opposites do attract. Maggie is very adventurous and impulsive, while Ashley is far more reserved. After studying and working hard to make their dreams come true, can this same sex couple win enough to pay off their debts and have a rich future together?

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Jenna and Sebastian are an attractive, fun couple who have been dating for a while. Jenna is a model, but her personality is what shines through on the big stage. Sebastian entertains on the small stage as well. But does Jenna know him well enough to help them win it all?

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Samantha and Matt are actors who met while on the job, entertaining on a cruise ship This bright and bubbly couple are hard not to root for. Does Samantha know Matt well enough to win it all?

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Jeff and Luke are two Broadway actors, who have been best friends for years. These two crass, narcissistic men love to pick up girls, entertain and dance. Can Luke help his bromance win a lot of cash? Or will they lose it all?

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: Marty and Lindsey have been dating for a while, but most of that time Marty has been deployed in Afghanistan. Now that he is back, his life has been tough. Does Lindsey know him well enough to win them the grand prize? It's an emotional ride in the finale of Separation Anxiety.

imdb.plot outline: Two people are invited to an "Internet gameshow" but are separated in order to play the game. One person is taken to a set that is made to look like a cheap Internet gameshow. The other person is taken to a set with a big audience and host Iliza Schlesinger tell them that their partner is not playing for $2500 but is actually playing for $250,000. The person in the studio picks categories for the person on the cheap set and tries to win as much money as possible while Iliza sets up minigames within the show.
imdb.title: Separation Anxiety
plot: Two people are invited to an "Internet gameshow" but are separated in order to play the game. One person is taken to a set that is made to look like a cheap Internet gameshow. The other person is taken to a set with a big audience and host Iliza Schlesinger tell them that their partner is not playing for $2500 but is actually playing for $250,000. The person in the studio picks categories for the person on the cheap set and tries to win as much money as possible while Iliza sets up minigames within the show.
